api_list.name: getAttachmentMetaData
api_list.description: Returns the metadata such as name and content-type for a given attachment and email.

api_list.name: getMissedEmail
api_list.description: List emails that were missed due to plan limits.

api_list.name: getEmailAttachments
api_list.description: Returns an array of attachment metadata such as name and content-type for a given email if present.

api_list.name: downloadAttachment
api_list.description: Returns the specified attachment for a given email as a stream / array of bytes. You can find attachment ids in email responses endpoint responses. The response type is application/octet-stream.

optional_parameters.name: apiKey
optional_parameters.description: Can pass apiKey in url for this request if you wish to download the file in a browser. Content type will be set to original content type of the attachment file. This is so that browsers can download the file correctly.

api_list.name: downloadAttachmentBase64
api_list.description: Returns the specified attachment for a given email as a base 64 encoded string. The response type is application/json. This method is similar to the `downloadAttachment` method but allows some clients to get around issues with binary responses.

api_list.name: getEmails
api_list.description: List emails that an inbox has received. Only emails that are sent to the inbox's email address will appear in the inbox. It may take several seconds for any email you send to an inbox's email address to appear in the inbox. To make this endpoint wait for a minimum number of emails use the `minCount` parameter. The server will retry the inbox database until the `minCount` is satisfied or the `retryTimeout` is reached

required_parameters.name: inboxId
required_parameters.description: Id of inbox that emails belongs to

optional_parameters.name: retryTimeout
optional_parameters.description: Maximum milliseconds to spend retrying inbox database until minCount emails are returned

optional_parameters.name: sort
optional_parameters.description: Sort the results by received date and direction ASC or DESC

optional_parameters.name: since
optional_parameters.description: Exclude emails received before this ISO 8601 date time

optional_parameters.name: minCount
optional_parameters.description: Minimum acceptable email count. Will cause request to hang (and retry) until minCount is satisfied or retryTimeout is reached.

optional_parameters.name: before
optional_parameters.description: Exclude emails received after this ISO 8601 date time

optional_parameters.name: size
optional_parameters.description: Alias for limit. Assessed first before assessing any passed limit.

optional_parameters.name: limit
optional_parameters.description: Limit the result set, ordered by received date time sort direction. Maximum 100. For more listing options see the email controller

api_list.name: getRawEmailJson
api_list.description: Returns a raw, unparsed, and unprocessed email wrapped in a JSON response object for easier handling when compared with the getRawEmail text/plain response

api_list.name: downloadBody
api_list.description: Returns the specified email body for a given email as a string

api_list.name: getEmailHTMLQuery
api_list.description: Parse an email body and return the content as an array of text. HTML parsing uses JSoup which supports JQuery/CSS style selectors

required_parameters.name: htmlSelector
required_parameters.description: HTML selector to search for. Uses JQuery/JSoup/CSS style selector like '.my-div' to match content. See https://jsoup.org/apidocs/org/jsoup/select/Selector.html for more information.

required_parameters.name: emailId
required_parameters.description: ID of email to perform HTML query on

api_list.name: waitForEmailCount
api_list.description: If inbox contains count or more emails at time of request then return count worth of emails. If not wait until the count is reached and return those or return an error if timeout is exceeded.

required_parameters.name: inboxId
required_parameters.description: Id of the inbox we are fetching emails from

required_parameters.name: count
required_parameters.description: Number of emails to wait for. Must be greater that 1

optional_parameters.name: delay
optional_parameters.description: Max milliseconds delay between calls

optional_parameters.name: sort
optional_parameters.description: Sort direction

optional_parameters.name: since
optional_parameters.description: Filter for emails that were received after the given timestamp

optional_parameters.name: before
optional_parameters.description: Filter for emails that were received before the given timestamp

optional_parameters.name: timeout
optional_parameters.description: Max milliseconds to wait

optional_parameters.name: unreadOnly
optional_parameters.description: Optional filter for unread only

api_list.name: getLatestEmail
api_list.description: Get the newest email in all inboxes or in a passed set of inbox IDs

optional_parameters.name: inboxIds
optional_parameters.description: Optional set of inboxes to filter by. Only get the latest email from these inbox IDs. If not provided will search across all inboxes

api_list.name: getEmailTextLines
api_list.description: Parse an email body and return the content as an array of strings. HTML parsing uses JSoup and UNIX line separators.

required_parameters.name: emailId
required_parameters.description: ID of email to fetch text for

optional_parameters.name: decodeHtmlEntities
optional_parameters.description: Decode HTML entities

optional_parameters.name: lineSeparator
optional_parameters.description: Line separator character

api_list.name: getEmailPreviewURLs
api_list.description: Get a list of URLs for email content as text/html or raw SMTP message for viewing the message in a browser.

api_list.name: getUnreadEmailCount
api_list.description: Get number of emails unread. Unread means has not been viewed in dashboard or returned in an email API response
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://jackmahoney-mailslurp-email-testing-v1.p.rapidapi.com/emails/unreadCount"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "jackmahoney-mailslurp-email-testing-v1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "jackmahoney-mailslurp-email-testing-v1.p.rapidapi.com"

api_list.name: getEmailLinks
api_list.description: HTML parsing uses JSoup and UNIX line separators. Searches content for href attributes

required_parameters.name: emailId
required_parameters.description: ID of email to fetch text for

api_list.name: getEmailHTML
api_list.description: Retrieve email content as HTML response for viewing in browsers. Decodes quoted-printable entities and converts charset to UTF-8. Pass your API KEY as a request parameter when viewing in a browser: `?apiKey=xxx`. Returns content-type `text/html;charset=utf-8` so you must call expecting that content response not JSON. For JSON response see the `getEmailHTMLJson` method.

api_list.name: getExpirationDefaults
api_list.description: Return default times used for inbox expiration

api_list.description: If nth email is already present in inbox then return it. If not hold the connection open until timeout expires or the nth email is received and returned.

optional_parameters.name: before
optional_parameters.description: Filter for emails that were received before the given timestamp

optional_parameters.name: timeout
optional_parameters.description: Max milliseconds to wait for the nth email if not already present

optional_parameters.name: index
optional_parameters.description: Zero based index of the email to wait for. If an inbox has 1 email already and you want to wait for the 2nd email pass index=1

optional_parameters.name: unreadOnly

optional_parameters.name: inboxId

api_list.name: doesInboxExist
api_list.description: Check if inboxes exist by email address. Useful if you are sending emails to mailslurp addresses

api_list.name: getEmail
api_list.description: Returns a email summary object with headers and content. To retrieve the raw unparsed email use the getRawEmail endpoints

optional_parameters.name: decode
optional_parameters.description: Decode email body quoted-printable encoding to plain text. SMTP servers often encode text using quoted-printable format (for instance `=D7`). This can be a pain for testing

api_list.name: getAllInboxes
api_list.description: List inboxes in paginated form. The results are available on the `content` property of the returned object. This method allows for page index (zero based), page size (how many results to return), and a sort direction (based on createdAt time). You Can also filter by whether an inbox is favorited or use email address pattern. This method is the recommended way to query inboxes. The alternative `getInboxes` method returns a full list of inboxes but is limited to 100 results.

optional_parameters.name: sort
optional_parameters.description: Optional createdAt sort direction ASC or DESC

optional_parameters.name: page
optional_parameters.description: Optional page index in list pagination

optional_parameters.name: before
optional_parameters.description: Optional filter by created before given date time

optional_parameters.name: domainId
optional_parameters.description: Optional domain ID filter

optional_parameters.name: since
optional_parameters.description: Optional filter by created after given date time

optional_parameters.name: size
optional_parameters.description: Optional page size in list pagination

optional_parameters.name: tag
optional_parameters.description: Optionally filter by tags. Will return inboxes that include given tags

optional_parameters.name: favourite
optional_parameters.description: Optionally filter results for favourites only

optional_parameters.name: search
optional_parameters.description: Optionally filter by search words partial matching ID, tags, name, and email address

optional_parameters.name: inboxType
optional_parameters.description: Optional filter by inbox type

optional_parameters.name: teamAccess
optional_parameters.description: DEPRECATED. Optionally filter by team access.

api_list.name: getExpiredInboxes
api_list.description: Inboxes created with an expiration date will expire after the given date. An ExpiredInboxRecord is created that records the inboxes old ID and email address. You can still read emails in the inbox (using the inboxes old ID) but the email address associated with the inbox can no longer send or receive emails. Fetch expired inbox records to view the old inboxes properties

optional_parameters.name: before
optional_parameters.description: Filter by created at before the given timestamp

optional_parameters.name: size
optional_parameters.description: Optional page size in inbox sent email list pagination

optional_parameters.name: sort
optional_parameters.description: Optional createdAt sort direction ASC or DESC

optional_parameters.name: page
optional_parameters.description: Optional page index in inbox sent email list pagination

optional_parameters.name: since
optional_parameters.description: Filter by created at after the given timestamp

api_list.name: getOrganizationInboxes
api_list.description: List organization inboxes in paginated form. These are inboxes created with `allowTeamAccess` flag enabled. Organization inboxes are `readOnly` for non-admin users. The results are available on the `content` property of the returned object. This method allows for page index (zero based), page size (how many results to return), and a sort direction (based on createdAt time).

optional_parameters.name: sort
optional_parameters.description: Optional createdAt sort direction ASC or DESC

optional_parameters.name: size
optional_parameters.description: Optional page size in list pagination

optional_parameters.name: searchFilter
optional_parameters.description: Optional search filter

optional_parameters.description: Optional page index in list pagination

optional_parameters.name: before

optional_parameters.name: since

api_list.name: getRawEmailContents

api_list.name: getEmailHTMLJson
api_list.description: Retrieve email content as HTML response. Decodes quoted-printable entities and converts charset to UTF-8. Returns content-type `application/json;charset=utf-8` so you must call expecting that content response not JSON.

api_list.name: getEmailsPaginated
api_list.description: By default returns all emails across all inboxes sorted by ascending created at date. Responses are paginated. You can restrict results to a list of inbox IDs. You can also filter out read messages

optional_parameters.name: unreadOnly
optional_parameters.description: Optional filter for unread emails only. All emails are considered unread until they are viewed in the dashboard or requested directly

optional_parameters.name: searchFilter
optional_parameters.description: Optional search filter. Searches email recipients, sender, subject, email address and ID. Does not search email body

optional_parameters.name: before
optional_parameters.description: Optional filter emails received before given date time

optional_parameters.name: sort
optional_parameters.description: Optional createdAt sort direction ASC or DESC

optional_parameters.name: size
optional_parameters.description: Optional page size in email list pagination. Maximum size is 100. Use page index and sort to page through larger results

optional_parameters.name: inboxId
optional_parameters.description: Optional inbox ids to filter by. Can be repeated. By default will use all inboxes belonging to your account.

optional_parameters.name: since
optional_parameters.description: Optional filter emails received after given date time

optional_parameters.name: page
optional_parameters.description: Optional page index in email list pagination

required_parameters.description: ID of the bounced email to fetch

api_list.name: getTestWebhookPayloadEmailRead
api_list.description: Get webhook test payload for email opened event
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://jackmahoney-mailslurp-email-testing-v1.p.rapidapi.com/webhooks/test/email-read-payload"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "jackmahoney-mailslurp-email-testing-v1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: getBouncedRecipients
api_list.description: Bounced recipients are email addresses that you have sent emails to that did not accept the sent email. Once a recipient is bounced you cannot send emails to that address.

optional_parameters.name: size
optional_parameters.description: Optional page size

optional_parameters.name: before
optional_parameters.description: Filter by created at before the given timestamp

optional_parameters.name: sort
optional_parameters.description: Optional createdAt sort direction ASC or DESC

optional_parameters.name: since
optional_parameters.description: Filter by created at after the given timestamp

optional_parameters.name: page
optional_parameters.description: Optional page index

api_list.name: getSmsMessagesPaginated
api_list.description: By default returns all SMS messages across all phone numbers sorted by ascending created at date. Responses are paginated. You can restrict results to a list of phone number IDs. You can also filter out read messages

optional_parameters.name: page
optional_parameters.description: Optional page index in SMS list pagination

optional_parameters.name: since
optional_parameters.description: Optional filter SMSs received after given date time

optional_parameters.name: unreadOnly
optional_parameters.description: Optional filter for unread SMS only. All SMS are considered unread until they are viewed in the dashboard or requested directly

optional_parameters.name: phoneNumber
optional_parameters.description: Optional receiving phone number to filter SMS messages for

optional_parameters.name: sort
optional_parameters.description: Optional createdAt sort direction ASC or DESC

optional_parameters.name: before
optional_parameters.description: Optional filter SMSs received before given date time

optional_parameters.name: size
optional_parameters.description: Optional page size in SMS list pagination. Maximum size is 100. Use page index and sort to page through larger results

optional_parameters.name: before

optional_parameters.name: since
